[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Function: run_cmd()] [Command injection] Can an attacker provide malicious command-line arguments through the Configuration struct that bypass validation in run_cmd(), potentially executing arbitrary code or manipulating node checker behavior? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Function: run_cmd()] [Error handling bypass] Does run_cmd() properly sanitize error messages from validate() before returning them, or can an attacker inject malicious data through configuration files that gets exposed in error messages, leading to information disclosure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Struct: Configuration] [Input validation] Can the clap Parser in Configuration be exploited with specially crafted arguments that cause buffer overflows, panics, or denial of service when parsing command-line inputs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Enum: Command] [Command enumeration] Does the Command enum properly validate that only the Validate variant can be executed, or can an attacker exploit enum deserialization to execute unintended command variants if additional variants are added in the future? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Function: run_cmd()] [Async safety] Can race conditions occur in the async run_cmd() function if multiple configurations are validated concurrently, leading to state corruption or inconsistent validation results? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [File type confusion] In read_configuration_from_file(), can an attacker craft a file with misleading extensions (e.g., .yaml file containing JSON) to bypass validation and inject malicious configuration data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [Path traversal] Does read_configuration_from_file() validate the PathBuf to prevent path traversal attacks where an attacker provides paths like '../../../etc/passwd' to read sensitive system files? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [Symlink exploitation] Can an attacker create symbolic links that read_configuration_from_file() follows to access restricted configuration files or leak sensitive node information? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [YAML deserialization attack] In FileType::try_into() using serde_yaml::from_reader(), can an attacker craft malicious YAML with recursive anchors, billion laughs attacks, or arbitrary code execution payloads? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [JSON deserialization attack] In FileType::try_into() using serde_json::from_reader(), can an attacker provide deeply nested JSON objects that cause stack overflow or consume excessive memory, crashing the node checker? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [File handle exhaustion] Does read_configuration_from_file() properly close file handles after reading, or can an attacker trigger file descriptor exhaustion by repeatedly requesting configuration validation? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [TOCTOU race condition] Between checking the file extension in FileType::try_from() and opening the file in try_into(), can an attacker swap the file to inject malicious content? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: common] [Extension validation bypass] Can an attacker use case-sensitivity tricks (e.g., .YaML, .YAML) or Unicode lookalikes to bypass the extension check and load unsupported file types? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [URL injection] In NodeAddress, can an attacker provide malicious URLs (e.g., file://, javascript:, data:) that bypass protocol validation and execute unintended operations when the node checker connects? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [SSRF vulnerability] Can NodeAddress.url be exploited for Server-Side Request Forgery attacks to scan internal networks, access metadata services (169.254.169.254), or probe restricted endpoints? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [Port overflow] Does NodeAddress properly validate that api_port, metrics_port, and noise_port are within valid u16 ranges and don't overlap with privileged ports (<1024) that could be exploited? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [Public key validation] In NodeAddress, can an attacker provide an invalid or malicious x25519::PublicKey that causes cryptographic operations to fail unsafely or leak private key material? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [DNS rebinding attack] In as_noise_network_address(), when DNS resolution occurs via socket_addrs(), can an attacker exploit DNS rebinding to redirect connections from legitimate nodes to malicious endpoints? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [Cookie injection] Does the cookie_store in NodeAddress properly validate and sanitize cookies, or can an attacker inject malicious cookies that get sent to target nodes, compromising authentication? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [HTTP request smuggling] Can NodeAddress.get_metrics_client() or get_api_client() be exploited for HTTP request smuggling by manipulating the timeout parameter or URL structure? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [Multiple IP resolution] When socket_addrs resolves to multiple IPs, only the first is used - can an attacker exploit DNS manipulation to control which IP gets selected, bypassing firewall rules? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [Noise port collision] Can an attacker configure noise_port to conflict with api_port or metrics_port, causing protocol confusion where Noise handshakes interfere with API requests? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: node_address] [NetworkAddress protocol injection] In as_noise_network_address().append_prod_protos(), can an attacker manipulate the protocol version parameter to bypass Noise encryption or downgrade security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Configuration ID collision] Can an attacker register multiple BaselineConfiguration instances with identical configuration_id values, causing configuration confusion or allowing unauthorized baseline node selection? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/configuration/mod.rs] [Module: types] [Baseline node spoofing] If node_address is optional in BaselineConfiguration, can an attacker omit it for checkers that require baseline data, causing checks to pass incorrectly or leak information? (High)
